li.a: Middle School Social and Emotional Supports

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-31ecedc elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h1: Food Distribution — From Lincoln Public Schools

div.p: Arabic_Meals | Karen_Meals | Russian_Meals | Spanish_Meals | Vietnamese_Meals

Last week, Lincoln Public Schools distributed approximately 52,500 meals at their 14 distribution sites. With the continued need in the community, two more sites have been added for distribution starting Monday, April 20.
In an effort to make sure more children are able to access healthy meals, and to maintain the safety of our community, the following procedures are in place:

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-22def88 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

ul.li: Drive-thru sites are being set up at each location and families are strongly encouraged to stay in their vehicles and pick up the child meals in the drive-thru lane. If possible, staff will place meals in the trunk of a vehicle.

There is a walk-up area available for families who do not have a vehicle, but long lines will not be allowed. Please follow the directions from LPS staff. Cones will be set to promote proper line spacing.
To keep everyone safe, please follow LPS staff directions and signage.
Please obey all traffic laws and do not block the regular flow of traffic, driveways or arterial streets surrounding schools.
The sites will open at 11 a.m. and vehicle lines will not be allowed to form more than five minutes prior to opening.
Each child will continue to receive five breakfasts and five lunch meals.

li.strong: The meals are for children only, and all children 18 and younger are eligible for meals at any site.

ul.li: Children need to be present to receive the meals. By remaining in vehicles there is limited contact or exposure.

Meals are also available to persons with disabilities, ages 18 to 21, who participate in LPS programs. They also need to be present to receive the meals. By remaining in vehicles there is limited contact or exposure.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-827397e elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Just a reminder, any Lincoln family can pick up meals for any child 1-18 at any grab-and-go location every Monday from 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
Additional LPS staff will be available at each site to ensure that proper social distancing measures are taking place for the health and safety of our community.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-4d1f1d6 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Vehicles enter the driveway on the north side of the school on W. Cumming Street and follow directions to Door 10

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-e9c5b90 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Vehicles enter near the swimming pool at 12th and Manatt streets and follow staff directions to Door 36 near Educare

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-520df7f elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Drive south on S. 46th Street, southbound vehicles pull into the bus cutout at Door 1 in front of school

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-68da0f8 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Take Clinton Street east to Door 3

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-be0c59e elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Turn south on 34th Street off Vine Street then enter the alley south of the school off 34th Street and pick up food at Door 8

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-ac334b8 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Northbound vehicles on 46th Street will drive into the bus lane at Door 1

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-7e15193 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Take Saratoga Street west into the bus lane

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-8c3629c elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Drive west on W. Dawes Avenue and pull into the bus lane at Door 1

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-0b34a78 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Just like school drop off, enter the driveway on Vine Street and follow the directions to Door 1

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-03a7a91 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Enter the driveway loop, from south, on Lewis Avenue and pick up meals at front of school

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-b912a04 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Enter the driveway loop, from south, on C Street and pick up meals at north end of driveway, exiting on to 48th Street.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-a9fec79 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Enter the driveway loop on F Street and pick up meals at Door 5

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-db2206e elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Enter the circle on 21st and J streets and follow staff directions

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-75bb627 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Enter the staff parking lot at Baldwin Street on the south side of the school and follow directions around the west side of the building to Door 35 near the cafeteria

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-70a08e9 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h2: From the Food Bank of Lincoln

div.h3: Schools with LPS BackPack Program and Food Markets

p.strong: ALL Schools with LPS BackPack Program and Food Markets

div.p: The Food Bank of Lincoln remains committed to feeding children and families. To ensure food distribution sustainability and help as many people as they can for as long as they can, the Food Bank of Lincoln will temporarily halt all BackPack Program activity and School Food Markets. You can find the Food Bank of Lincoln’s distribution schedule for the week here: https://www.lincolnfoodbank.org/get-food/food-distribution-schedule/

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-4da39a5 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

h2.strong: The Food Bank of Lincoln has these requirements for anyone who attends food distribution:

ul.li: Only one member per household, unless you have physical limitations.
Maintain at least 6 feet between yourself and other individuals.
All available food will be pre-bagged. You must take the complete bag without exception.
They cannot and will not accept individual items back once they have been distributed.

They will distribute food in a drive-thru model. Please note: They are taking the health and safety of their staff. extremely seriously. Therefore, staff will not be allowed to carry products to or lift products into vehicles.
Do not approach Food Bank tables or vehicles. They will designate a location within a safe distance where you can collect your bag of food.

div.p: Following our standard LPS closure policy, the LPS Emergency Pantry will NOT be open while LPS is closed. For more information about accessing the Lincoln Food Bank distribution locations visit their website.

a.span: For more information about accessing the Lincoln Food Bank other distribution locations visit their website.

div.h5: Keep up-to-date with what's happening throughout Lincoln Public Schools
div.p: Subscribe to receive our ConnectLPS email newsletter

Lincoln Public Schools is the second largest public school district in Nebraska, located in the heart of the plains, renowned for its long-standing legacy of educational excellence and tradition of rigorous academic achievement. The school district is growing and thriving, serving over 42,000 students in more than 60 schools and programs.

The Lincoln Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, age, genetic information, citizenship status or economic status in its programs, activities and employment.
